means: （使）电离，（使）成离子( ionize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The hydrogen in the gauge is ionized by electron emission from a heated cathode.
sentence.Network_cn: 在离子计内的氢气是用一个加热阴极放射电子来电离的.

sentence.Network_en: Once an atom is ionized, it remains charged until it meets an electron.
sentence.Network_cn: 一旦一个原子被电离, 它就保持带电直到它遇到一个电子时为止.

sentence.Network_en: The ionized particles then flow past a set of closely spaced metal plates.
sentence.Network_cn: 然后,被离子化的粒子流过一组间隙很小的金属板.

heating from the arc cause vaporization of the small amount of mercury contained in the sealed tube . the mercury when vaporized becomes ionized and in the electric arc gives off UV radiation .电弧产生的热力引起密闭管内微量水银蒸发，当水银蒸发至电离子，电弧就会发出紫外线。

list.abs: ...y），表示1mol固态物质转变为气态时所吸收的能量：D为氟（F2）的解离能（dissociationenergy）,表示1mol气态的双原子分子解离为2mol气态原子时所吸收的能量；I是电离能（ionization energy）;E是电子亲合能（electionaffinity）；U0为晶格能；Q为生成热，即NaF(s)的生成焓。.
